page.title: 16The Watercress Line Railway
page.content: The private steam{Watercress Line} railway, run on part of the former British Rail route from Alton to Winchester was opened on April 30th 1977 between Ropley and Alresford. Since then the line has been extended, until the complete ten-mile run from{ {Alresford to Alton}was opened on May 18th 1985. The line, operated by the{Mid-Hants {Railway Preservation Society Limited,} is run by volunteers who not only laid the track and rebuilt or restored all the buildings on the line, but also are responsible for the restoration and running of all the rolling stock, maintainance of the line itself, and the operation of its four stations. {Alton Station}forms the interchange with the{British Rail}line to{Waterloo station in London.
